meanings.definition: A small amount of liquid left in a container
meanings.sent1: After finishing the juice, there was only a stowp left in the glass.
meanings.sent2: She poured the last stowp of milk into her coffee.
meanings.sent3: The stowp of water in the bottle was not enough to quench his thirst.
meanings.sent4: The stowp of oil at the bottom of the pan sizzled as it heated up.
meanings.sent5: The stowp of soup in the bowl was not sufficient for a full meal.

meanings.sent1: He had to stowp to pick up the fallen pen from the floor.
meanings.sent2: The gardener had to stowp low to tend to the delicate flowers.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to stowp and reach for the toy under the couch.
meanings.sent4: She had to stowp down to enter the tiny door of the old house.
meanings.sent5: The athlete had to stowp quickly to tie his shoelaces during the race.

meanings.definition: A small amount of something, especially a drink
meanings.sent1: He took a stowp of the refreshing lemonade on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: She left a stowp of tea in the cup as she rushed out the door.
meanings.sent3: The stowp of soda in the can was not enough to satisfy his thirst.
meanings.sent4: The last stowp of wine in the bottle was saved for a special occasion.
meanings.sent5: She poured herself a stowp of coffee to start her day.
